metrics.description: The total number of AI agent spans captured. This metric provides a baseline measure of your AI agent activity and usage volume across your application.
The number of users producing at least one AI agent span. This metric measures discovery/adoption of your AI agent features.

metrics.displayName: Number of calls for creating new thread with AI agent
metrics.description: The total number of AI agent operations that create new threads. This metric helps track how frequently new conversation threads are being initiated in your AI agent implementation.

metrics.displayName: Number of calls for creating new message with AI agent
metrics.description: The total number of AI agent operations that create new messages. This metric helps track how frequently new messages are being sent in your AI agent implementation. It should be roughly equal to the number of process_thread_run calls.

metrics.displayName: Number of calls for processing thread run with AI agent
metrics.description: The total number of AI agent operations that process thread runs. This metric helps track how frequently thread runs are being processed in your AI agent implementation.
The total input tokens used for AI agent calls. This metric helps track the overall token usage in your AI agent implementation and can be used to estimate costs.
The average number of input tokens used per AI agent call. This metric helps track prompt efficiency and identify opportunities to optimize your prompts for cost reduction.
The 90th percentile input tokens per AI agent call. This gives an indication of the input token usage near the upper end of the distribution, helping identify outliers in prompt length.
The median (50th percentile) input tokens per AI agent call. This provides the typical prompt length used in your application, less influenced by outliers than the average.

metrics.displayName: Total AI agent usage output tokens
metrics.description: The total number of output tokens generated across all AI agent interactions. This key cost metric directly impacts billing and helps forecast expenses. Combined with input token metrics, it provides complete visibility into token consumption patterns and can identify opportunities for optimization.
The average number of output tokens generated per AI agent call. This metric helps track response efficiency and identify opportunities to optimize your AI agent responses for cost reduction.
The 90th percentile output tokens per AI agent call. This gives an indication of the response length near the upper end of the distribution, helping identify particularly verbose responses.
The median (50th percentile) output tokens per AI agent call. This provides the typical response length in your application, less influenced by outliers than the average.
The average duration of AI agent calls. This metric helps track the performance of your AI agent implementation and identify potential bottlenecks.
The 90th percentile duration of AI agent calls. This gives an indication of the performance near the upper end of the distribution, helping identify outliers in processing time.
The median (50th percentile) duration of AI agent calls. This provides the typical processing time in your application, less influenced by outliers than the average.
The total number of code interpreter calls. This metric helps track how frequently the code interpreter is being used in your AI agent implementation.
The total number of file search calls. This metric helps track how frequently the file search is being used in your AI agent implementation.

metrics.displayName: Input tokens for calls related to file search
metrics.description: The total number of input tokens used for file search related process_thread_run calls. This metric helps track the overall token usage in your AI agent implementation and can be used to estimate costs.

metrics.displayName: Input tokens for calls related to code interpreter
metrics.description: The total number of input tokens used for code interpreter related process_thread_run calls. This metric helps track the overall token usage in your AI agent implementation and can be used to estimate costs.

metrics.displayName: Output tokens for calls related to file search
metrics.description: The total number of output tokens used for file search related process_thread_run calls. This metric helps track the overall token usage in your AI agent implementation and can be used to estimate costs.

metrics.displayName: Output tokens for calls related to code interpreter
metrics.description: The total number of output tokens used for code interpreter related process_thread_run calls. This metric helps track the overall token usage in your AI agent implementation and can be used to estimate costs.

metrics.displayName: Number of users using code interpreter
metrics.description: The number of users producing at least one code interpreter span. This metric measures discovery/adoption of your code interpreter features.

metrics.displayName: Number of users using file search
metrics.description: The number of users producing at least one file search span. This metric measures discovery/adoption of your file search features.

metrics.displayName: Number of code interpreter tool calls
metrics.description: The total number of code interpreter tool calls. This metric helps track how frequently the code interpreter is being used in your AI agent implementation.

metrics.displayName: Number of code interpreter tool calls
metrics.description: The total number of code interpreter tool calls. This metric helps track how frequently the code interpreter is being used in your AI agent implementation.
